User.title: User
User.description: Represents a user of the Eclat Boutique platform.

firstName.description: The first name of the user.

lastName.description: The last name of the user.

email.description: The email address of the user.

registrationDate.description: The date and time the user registered.

Product.title: Product
Product.description: Represents a product available for sale in the Eclat Boutique.

description.description: A detailed description of the product.

category.description: The category of the product (e.g., clothing, accessories).

gender.description: The target gender for the product (e.g., male, female, unisex).

Order.title: Order
Order.description: Represents an order placed by a user.

orderDate.description: The date and time the order was placed.

status.description: The current status of the order (e.g., pending, processing, shipped, delivered).

totalAmount.description: The total amount of the order.

OrderItem.title: OrderItem
OrderItem.description: Represents an item within an order.

id.description: Unique identifier for the order item.

quantity.description: The quantity of the product in the order.

price.description: The price of the product at the time of the order.

Favorite.title: Favorite
Favorite.description: Represents a product added to a user's favorites list.

id.description: Unique identifier for the favorite item.

addedDate.description: The date and time the product was added to favorites.

Review.title: Review
Review.description: Represents a review of a product by a user.

rating.description: The rating given by the user (e.g., 1-5 stars).

comment.description: The user's comment about the product.

reviewDate.description: The date and time the review was submitted.

firestore.reasoning: The Firestore data structure is designed to support Eclat Boutique's features, focusing on user authentication, product catalog management, orders, favorites, and reviews. The structure emphasizes authorization independence to facilitate secure and scalable operations. Path-based ownership is used for user-specific data (orders, favorites, reviews) to simplify security rules. Products are stored in a top-level collection to allow for easy querying and display. Authorization Independence is maintained via path based ownership on User data.
